node.statement: (L^p integrability of smeared Wick powers) The random variables <psi, :phi^3:> and <psi^2, :phi^2:> are in L^p(mu) for all p >= 1. Proof: By the continuity of the duality pairing, |<psi, :phi^k:>| <= ||psi||_{C^{k/2+delta}} ||:phi^k:||_{C^{-k/2-delta}} for k = 2, 3. Since psi in C^inf is fixed, ||psi||_{C^{k/2+delta}} is a finite constant. Therefore E_mu[|<psi, :phi^k:>|^p] <= ||psi||_{C^{k/2+delta}}^p E_mu[||:phi^k:||_{C^{-k/2-delta}}^p]. By the uniform moment bounds from node 1.6.1.2 (specifically, Mourrat-Weber 2017, Proposition 3.2 and Gubinelli-Hofmanova 2019, Proposition 2.3), E_mu[||:phi^k:||_{C^{-k/2-delta}}^p] < infinity for all p >= 1 and k = 2, 3. Hence <psi, :phi^k:> in L^p(mu) for all p >= 1, completing the proof of node 1.6.1. QED.
